I love this game but I just got the new level but sometimes it doesn‚Äôt recognize that my fingers are touching the screen and it is really annoying because then I can‚Äôt play. Otherwise it is really fun and a game I would recommend

Overall like the game; graphics are great, and brings back some nostalgia.  However, when using the Apple Magic Keyboard with my iPad Pro 12.9‚Äù, movements using the directional arrows result in double-moves for each keypress.  Disappointed in this oversight, and I have not been able to find any adjustment or setting to resolve the issue.
Can we just play the game

I‚Äôve only played several levels so far but I have an opinion. Overall, I think it‚Äôs a great game. I love the graphics. And all the different obstacles add a nice touch. However, when I looked at the reviews for the game, I saw something about being able to jump on cars. I‚Äôve tried this, and can‚Äôt seem to be able to get it right. Most of the time, the game decides: No and then kills you. I assume that there‚Äôs a correct time to jump, but I just don‚Äôt know. The only consistent method I‚Äôve found is dying, and then you are able to jump on the cars. If this could get some attention, that would be great. I would like some clarification on this issue.

title.label: Needs a lot o bug fixes

content.label: I hate how my sister‚Äôs phone doesn‚Äôt let her get in this game when she tried to open it is said you request is taking longer than usual and then she starts to cry it happens every time when she tries to open this game. IS THIS A JOKE!? Plz do the next update right now with bug fixes
This game looks great and has potential but the movements are horrible. The reaction time is terrible. Make the movements of the frog more reactive to quicker taps of the screen.

I am extremely frustrated with this game, yes the graphics are great and all but I was expecting it to be a really fun game to play and unfortunately due to control issues as many people have mentioned I could barely get past level one on my phone. Not only is it frustrating when you swipe left/right or tap to jump out of the way and nothing happens but it‚Äôs also extremely frustrating when they allow the froglets to go off screen or in an area where you cannot reach them (when saving them is the main objective of the game.) On top of that where is the consistency with jumping on vehicles? Am I not allowed to jump on trucks and only on cars? Am I not allowed to jump on either? I feel like sometimes I can jump on trucks and cars and sometimes I can‚Äôt at all or I lose a life. It‚Äôs extremely disappointing when you have high hopes for a game but you are only let down because the game is more frustrating than it‚Äôs worth.

This game has terrible responsiveness and lacks the clean functionality of the OG game. The 3D world makes it very hard to navigate and judge obstacles. I want to like it but when even the first level is more frustrating than fun, you know it‚Äôs gonna be a problem.

title.label: Apple Arcade is less than vanilla

content.label:
It‚Äôs like when Apple had Scully run Jobs out. They just let anyone use the Apple OS. 

There are no standards, quality control, premium titles, physical controls have finally begun working but often have no instruction for the controls. The games are rushed after thoughts. 

Apple has paid developers in hopes that they would make games people would want to play but the games are pitiful and lack luster. Even titles with ‚Äúbig names‚Äù or licenses. 

Games often lack any real satisfying sense of progression and get deleted because the first time user experience is complete trash with most games. 

There‚Äôs no creativity, graphics and touch screen games made for babies. These devices have all kinds of sensors that could be used. 

Why is Apple Arcade in this state? The developers never had to earn the success that comes with listening to gamers and the money they‚Äôd fork out for something decent. 

Instead the developers are subject to the Apple overlords who have spoiled the developers rotten, they meet their minimum requirements, sit back and collect a check. 

Apple should be providing code standards for local and online networking for multiplayer functionality. 

Apple could dominate but instead they will just throw more money at it (100s of millions) and never come close to the industry leader, especially with Apple Arcade. Charging $5 a month devalues every single game in its walled garden. If a game doesn‚Äôt catch your attention in 30 seconds people just delete it. This failure comes from a lack of outside testing focus groups. As obvious as this may seem it‚Äôs far from common. 

The recent releases of the iPhone 12 camera line didn‚Äôt mention a thing worth noting about gaming at all. Why? Apple Arcade is thus far a dismal failure.
Impossible froglets while trying to move your frog

title.label: Post update, Frogger is a blast!

content.label: I have loved Frogger ever since the first ps1 game. It was simple challenging fun. This is the first time in a long time that a frogger game has grabbed me. I can‚Äôt seem to put this down. The redesign is adorable and the way his little feet stick to the physics based objects in the game as they roll around is charming. I can‚Äôt wait to play more of thos. Simple intuitive controls make this a must play for anyone that has ever enjoyed a good frogger game.

The game lags so hard I can‚Äôt even play it, PERIOD.
That‚Äôs it, would be an interesting game, just can‚Äôt play it.

title.label: The controls are ruining the game experience

content.label: This game is great when it comes to aesthetics, but the on screen controls are so bad that I find myself no longer wanting to play the game because it is such a negative experience. Can you please fix this somehow like maybe add a joystick or something.

Frgger is practically uncontrollable.  There is always a lag, after you tap or swipe, so it is impossible to time your moves.  It‚Äôs almost impossible to keep the ‚Äúfroglets‚Äù alive, because you have no control over them, so when you jump to a safe spot, they don‚Äôt.  

My entire family tried the game and we all deleted it, in frustration, after ten minutes.

title.label: Great game but something is missing

content.label: So I‚Äôm in love with this game already and it‚Äôs great there‚Äôs just one thing.... so whenever I get hit by something.. the froglet is that I worked hard to save... they just run away... so what I‚Äôm suggesting here is whenever the player gets hit by something and they lose a heart... have the froglets STAY WITH FROGGER!!!
Downloaded it yesterday and I‚Äôm already addicted.
It could be a great game but the frog doesn‚Äôt respond to the controls correctly which often results in a dead frog.

I was super excited when I saw frogger but the game controls are horrible. If I drag, point or tap right it goes left and vice verse. Please fix. This game with improvements is definitely a 5 star game
The controls are horrible makes it sometimes impossible.
Game plays and is fun, but no sound or music on my IPad. Going too uninstall and reinstall see if that corrects.

Sometimes I really love this game, but I find that the controls and other aspects of gameplay don‚Äôt always work as expected. For example, despite my furious swiping I sometimes cannot get my frog to climb up objects (like lamps and shovel handles). I wish the game would not allow me to throw objects in the wrong direction (as sometimes my frog will accidentally be facing backwards).
I wish I knew exactly when I can and cannot jump on a moving vehicle - seems like sometimes I can and other times I just die. Sometimes there are many obstacles (helicopters, toy trucks, lawnmowers) but there are no objects that I can possibly pick up to defeat them and therefore I just die.
PLEASE make gameplay more controllable, consistent, and predictable.
I was so excited to try this. The control system on my iPad makes this game infuriating. Play for 5 minutes and you will know exactly what I mean.

title.label: Frogger has returned to Being a CLASSIC!

content.label:
When you think about it, frogger has been sucking lately with titles like frogger 3D or frogger adventures: the rescue.
Konami FINALLY made a decent frogger game. More amazing than decent, actually. Keep it up, Konami!

Ridiculously impossible do to limitations with controlling via iPad/iPhone controls. Why create a game for an App Store where the majority of players will not be using a gaming controller. There are frogs impossible to get via the limited controls therefore ,a,omg achievements and progress impossible. I‚Äôll be canceling my arcade subscription, it‚Äôs just not worth it when games are made impossible to play this way. I‚Äôm disappointed.
This game I can‚Äôt move or jump I what a re fun
Hate it laggy sooooooo much talking hate it don‚Äôt get it

My kids love playing this game. Gameplay is straightforward, colorful, and fun with quality graphics and sounds. 

The (significant) problem is how unnecessarily complicated it is to set up a multiplayer game. We primarily play on Apple TV, and have controllers.

 You‚Äôd think that the simplest way to enable multiplayer would be to allow a second controller to simply allow the second player to join. Or one player uses the Siri remote and the other use an extra controller or keyboard. But no. 

To play this multiplayer, you have to have a second device WITH the game installed and WITH a separate game center account (meaning if you are a grownup with an Apple TV and an iPhone both using the same game center account, you can‚Äôt use your iPhone to play multiplayer with the Apple TV). Still, other Apple Arcade games do this, and while annoying it‚Äôs not enough a problem in and of itself. Except for this game connecting was very buggy.  In my case, I got it working with one of my kids‚Äô iPad minis, but it took forever to get it connected. I‚Äôd send an ‚Äúinvite‚Äù to my kid‚Äôs iPad, and on the iPad a game center invite pops up for literally 5 seconds. If you don‚Äôt tap the invite in those 5 seconds, it goes away, and subsequent invites will simply never appear. I tried quitting both games (on Apple TV and on iPad). No joy. Only thing that ended up working was to do the invite in the opposite direction (invite from the iPad to the Apple TV), and use the remote menu button to accept that invite within 5 seconds (the MFi controller menu button won‚Äôt work to accept the invite, it has to be the Siri remote menu button).  Of course, you don‚Äôt want to actually play this game because then you‚Äôd both be playing on the iPad instead of the big screen tv (whoever sends the invite hosts the game visuals, with the invited device acting only as a controller). So then, once connected in that direction, I ‚Äúcancelled co-op play‚Äù, and I got a screen that said ‚Äúco-op play ended‚Äù. This seems to reset the invite procedure. So doing this allowed me to now send an invite from the Apple TV to the iPad and get another 5 second opportunity to tap that invite on the iPad. 

Once you get through this ridiculous setup procedure, the two player gameplay is plenty fun. But you are left wondering why on earth they require a second device with a separate game center account to play multiplayer. And you end up avoiding the game because it won‚Äôt be worth the time to setup the connection. It‚Äôs local WiFi only, so it‚Äôs not like you can play with someone outside your own home. 

PLEASE enable the co-op play via a second Bluetooth controller.
The game won‚Äôt even open.

Love that my 3.5yo can play this game relatively easily on her own but I really wanted to play co-op to help her get past the baddies. Unfortunately you can‚Äôt play with multiple controllers on a single AppleTV. I tried the game center co-op but despite my AppleTV and iPhone being on the same WiFi network, it wouldn‚Äôt find both devices. Might be because I only have a single Game Center account but this should be possible so families can play!
This game is extremely fun. The graphics are amazing and I am in awe at each new level. It‚Äôs very challenging and keeps me coming back for more. I‚Äôm excited to try the co-op version.

Frog doesn‚Äôt respond very well to movements where you direct him to go. Runs into things and misses things too easily. Very frustrating bc the screen runs and you end up getting stuck trying to get him to go right or left or forwards or back bc you can‚Äôt control him very well.

It‚Äôs Konami so I don‚Äôt ever expect this game to be fixed. The spawns for items are glitchy forcing you to reload constantly and at times the levels feel impossible. They‚Äôre not, but they can feel that way. My 4-year-old, and my wife and I completed everything on the game and while it was frustrating at times, we still had a lot of fun and would play new levels if added. That doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs a good game, just fun. If the broken loading elements were fixed it would actually be pretty great, but they already got Apples money so they obviously don‚Äôt care to fix it.

I‚Äôve been pretty into this game for the last month. I started out using the touch controls, but realized quickly that I would need to use my Xbox controller if I was going to get anywhere, and sure enough the final stages are pretty brutal. This game has amazing graphics and a lot of charm. Some of the costumes are a trip for sure.  The levels are really creative too.

I do agree with others that a couple of the frogs here and there are almost impossible to get, and it can be deflating to lose them all right before the end of the level, though I don‚Äôt mind the difficulty. Once I decided I didn‚Äôt have to 100% the game and just get to the end, it became a lot better for me. I do strive to access all of the secret stages as well.

One more thing: is there still going to be a co-op mode?

The game is so beautifully made that I loved it the first time I saw it. I enjoyed the interesting levels, but there was one problem that really bothered me. (mine is an iPhone8 plus.) the touch on the iPhone is often out of order and delayed, making it easy for the game to fail to respond. This also makes the game more difficult to play, and hopefully the developers will improve on this, making the ‚Äúfrogger‚Äù more responsive and improving its fluency.

title.label: Great concept, terrible controls and movement

content.label: Was so happy when this was released, from the looks of it reminded me of the old Frogger Swampy‚Äôs Revenge I played in the late 90s on PC! But, unfortunately the controls are awful and make moving the characters painfully not fun. Fix that and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll be just as addicted to this as that old Frogger game.
The concept of this is great. Movement of the frog using just the iPhone is absolutely terrible. There‚Äôs a delay, and doesn‚Äôt always go in the direction you tap. Deleting this out of frustration.

Love the graphics and Frogger is really cute but this game is too hard. The minute you get hit by one thing you lose your froglets and then have to restart the level to re-get them. Some levels seem almost impossible to get them all.
Seems even if you turn the music and sound off in the game settings, the game stops any music or audio you have playing in another app. This makes it unplayable for me.

I love this game.  The controls are a little slow BUT the creativity is AWESOME!! It is still tons of fun and a favorite of mine all time over the years and they didn‚Äôt dissapoint! I just wish PlayStation would bring back Swampy‚Äôs revenge. Lol!
Love this game!  Finished all houses with three stars on every level. And still no Winter Nightmare! What‚Äôs going on?
Made it to the second level? Can‚Äôt avoid the pumpkins at all... controls are terrible.. just a halfassed game like everything else on Apple Arcade. Canceling service.

title.label: Too many glitches and not consistent!

content.label:
This game is fun, but there are too many glitches and inconsistent jumping and reactions. 

There are times Frogger jumps sideways when you want to go forward.  Jumping on the same items have different reactions and you lose opportunities to rescue baby frogs. The jumping distance isn‚Äôt consistent and you‚Äôre constantly trying to correct your distance and angle.  Sometimes you‚Äôre able to jump on moving vehicles and items, other times you‚Äôre killed and lose the baby frogs.
I just played for 30 minutes.  Controls are delayed and not at all precise or responsive. Ruined the game.  Not fun.

At first, I except quality, and it was actually some decent graphics. What I don‚Äôt like, is the framerate. Maybe i‚Äôam not seeing things right. Is it 60 FPS? I have no idea if you even care, but do you have incoming updates? Sorry for the change of subject, but I‚Äôam like a Computer Geek, so... anyway, I‚Äôam a coder, so you know you are getting an ACTUAL positive Review. I would love a better user Interface, since I prefer premium controls. HUD is fine. Anyway, the game is really nice!
Thank you KONAMI.

PS‚Äî make better controls. Here is an example. You die sometimes when you are NOT even close to cars. Thank you!

This is a very frustrating game. I can‚Äôt stand how you have to start over again if your frog gets knocked down or you lose baby frogs. It makes me just quit and stop playing. The controls are terrible. The battery drain (iPad Pro) is literally unbelievable. It makes my device get very hot and just a small bit of gameplay will deplete your battery from 100 to 60 in an hour. So far I‚Äôm not digging any of the games on Apple Arcade, which is pretty disappointing.
This game does not feel smooth whatsoever, very choppy. You can die way too easily by the cars.

I have not played this game long, and I think it is a cool take on the classic game Frogger. The graphics are super creative with toys and the crawling baby, but please, please change the music. I‚Äôm not sure who chose this background music, but to put it quit simply, I hate it. And I cannot play very long before I have to quite the game all due the game music. Yes, I know I can turn the music off, but that‚Äôs part of the game!! An example of excellent game music is altos adventure. It makes the game. Maybe give us choice of some different music. Otherwise fun and creative game.
